reviews.review_msg: She's an awesome prof. A genuinely nice person and is extremely, extremely intelligent/well-versed in all aspects of class material. An interest in political economy is recommended for this class, or you may as well shrivel up and die throughout the semester.

Very nice and knowledgeable. Great prof for CMNS 443. English isn't great but is always available for help to explain concepts further. Bit of group work but decent format. Interesting material. Could make certain concepts clearer in class from the readings. Loved her despite a few teaching flaws she had!

In response to others comments. Yes her English is a bit broken and she is soft spoken. She is very knowledgeable, but does take a bit of time to formulate her sentences. Non the less, in CMNS 443 she had a great outline and it was a very interesting course. I would recommend CMNS 443 with her.

The students that are rating her poorly did not take the time to listen & absorb what she was saying in class, or grasp the readings well enough. She does have broken English & it makes her lecture a little bit disjointed but she is very willing to help students understand concepts. I am far from an A student and I found this class was just fine.

The presentations take all over the class, she barely says nothing in a 4 hours lecture. And the final term paper, she first said we are welcomed to choose topic by ourself, however, she has a strong censorship over the topic. And YOU have to email her your topic to get approved by her in order to begin. An denied topic is usually happens

Jin is an excellent prof who really knows his stuff. I think his only downfall is his thick accent, which is a shame because he is an incredibly bright and intelligent guy and it shows in his writing. But the lectures were so enjoyable, despite being difficult to understand. I really did enjoy the class though!
You can learn a lot from professor Jin, and he is very approachable in class. He is smart, funny, and caring. However, outside of class, he seems very busy about his life

He is an expert in his fields of study, generous and humorous, not a tough grader definitely, and he's a very flexible person. I liked this prof so much and the contexts of his lecture were pretty interesting too! recommended!

Loved this professor until I realized how absolutely unreasonable he can be. If you are a busy working student, DO NOT take his class because he has no consideration for genuine reasons provided for an extension. Very disappointed in the end.

The course material is way too broad, but Jin is a really nice person; the course is pretty self-explanatory, and there's not much to go to him for (he does drift off-topic in lecture and in conversation). As for his English, he does have a slight accent, but his writing is clear and easy to understand, and no reason not to comprehend his lectures.
nice prof. the materials were way too broad unfortunately
